notes: Tutorial story demonstrating HP, inventory, equipment, special-item interactions, and multiple ending types.
Revisits advance narrative state via flags; no infinite loops.
Narrative avoids explicit enumeration of hidden requirements.

sections.text:
Moonlight breaks on shattered stone. The ruin’s entrance yawns like a cracked jaw, its archway half-swallowed by ivy and time.

You came because the local road has gone quiet—and because something in the dark has started paying attention.

Your candle burns steady, as if it wants to be seen.
sections.system: Tutorial: Your choices move the story. Consequences can change HP, inventory, and flags.

choices.label: Circle the entrance and scout for danger

sections.text:
You cross the threshold.

Dust puffs under your boots. A corridor stretches forward—collapsed in places, but passable. Your candlelight catches carvings worn smooth by centuries.

Somewhere deeper, water drips… then stops.

choices.label: Try the side door with a faded chapel sigil

sections.text:
You circle the archway. The stone here is newer—repairs made long after the ruin fell.

You find scuffed footprints in the dirt. Fresh. Not yours.

Near the threshold, a thin wire glints faintly.

choices.label: Disarm the wire and enter carefully

sections.text:
The corridor narrows.

A stone plate shifts under your weight.

A dart snaps from the wall and bites into your shoulder.

Pain blooms hot, then cold.

choices.label: Rip the dart free and keep moving
Spot the mechanism in time and avoid the dart

sections.text:
The side door groans open.

Inside is a narrow chapel—collapsed roof, shattered altar, and a single iron reliquary left intact.

Your candle flame leans toward it.
sections.system: Some objects respond to presence rather than force.

sections.text:
The corridor opens into a fractured hall.

Broken pillars. Smashed mosaics.

A dark pool sits at the center like spilled ink.

Something scrapes across stone.

You bind the wound and steady your breathing.

The pain dulls.

Not gone—managed.

The reliquary opens with a soft click.

Inside rests a small charm etched with looping runes.

It feels deliberate.

Like a mark of recognition.

A cave-wight slides into view.

Thin limbs. Pale eyes.

It sniffs the air.

You are not seen. Yet.

The wight turns.

Too fast.

Its claw grazes your side as you recoil.

You raise the candle.

The flame does not flare.

It tightens—focused, almost restrained.

For a moment, the stone seems thinner here, as if something on the other side is listening but not yet answering.

Whatever this place expects, it is not finished with you.
sections.system: Some interactions respond differently after certain experiences.

sections.text:
You stand before the sealed door.

It does not threaten you.

It waits.

You sense that forcing it would work—but only in the way storms work.

There is another way.

One that feels deliberate.

Chosen.

You can try now.

Or you can leave with your life.

choices.label: Attempt to complete what the ruin is waiting for
Force the door with brute strength

sections.text:
The door opens.

Not like stone parting.

Like breath being released after centuries.

Inside, names line the walls.

You add yours.

The ruin accepts you.

For now.

You hurl yourself against the stone.

It yields.

But something yields back.

A presence.

A hand.

Too long.

Too patient.

You leave the ruin alive.

Not victorious.

But intact.

Sometimes survival is enough.

You escape.

But the ruin remembers you.

And memory is a kind of chain.

You leave with no treasure.

Only understanding.

In Lorecraft, that counts.

Your strength gives out.

The ruin waits.

Stone always does.
